NEWS
from
The Corporation for Public Broadcasting
555 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
(212) 582-2020
(J. C. Dine)
FOR RELEASE AFTER 2:30 P.M.,
THURSDAY, 6 FEBRUARY 1969
CORPORATION FOR PUBLIC BROADCASTING
NAMES JOHN W. MACY, JR., PRESIDENT
New York, February 6 -- John W. Macy, Jr., Chairman of the
U. S. Civil Service Commission under Presidents Kennedy and
Johnson, and a former Executive Vice President of Wesleyan
University, Middletown, Connecticut, has been elected
President of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, it was
announced today by Frank Pace, Jr., Chairman of the Board.
The Corporation for Public Broadcasting is a nonÂ¬
profit agency. Federally-chartered under the Public
Broadcasting Act of 1967 to coordinate and fund public
broadcasting in the United States.
(MORE)
